  • Method Details

    • isAnomaly

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ItemPriceResponse> isAnomaly(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid ItemPriceRequest request) throws ProductNotFoundException
      Checks if a given price for a specific item is considered an anomaly. This endpoint accepts a JSON request containing an item ID and a price. It uses the ProductService to determine if the provided price is an anomaly compared to historical data for the item. The response includes the item ID, the provided price, the anomaly status, metadata, and custom headers.
      Parameters:
      request - The ItemPriceRequest object containing the item ID and price to be checked. The request body must be a valid JSON object with the following structure: 
                      {
                    "item_id": "12345",
                    "price": 100.0
                }
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing an ItemPriceResponse object. The response includes:
      • item_id: The ID of the item being checked.
      • price: The price provided in the request.
      • anomaly: A string indicating whether the price is an anomaly (e.g., "Yes", "No").
      • metadata: A CustomResponse object with a success message.
      • status_code: The HTTP status code (200 for success).
      • Headers: Custom headers including API method, version, and content type.
      Throws:
      ProductNotFoundException - If the item ID provided in the request does not exist in the system.
      See Also:
      • ProductService
      • ItemPriceRequest
      • ItemPriceResponse
      • CustomResponse
      • HttpHeaders
      • Example request: 
         POST /isAnomaly
 Content-Type: application/json

 {
     "item_id": "12345",
     "price": 100.0
 }
        Example response: 
         {
     "item_id": "12345",
     "price": 100.0,
     "anomaly": "No",
     "metadata": {
         "message": "Operation successful"
     },
     "status_code": "200"
 }
        Custom headers included in the response:
        • API-Method: Indicates the API method used (e.g., "isAnomaly").
        • API-Version: Indicates the API version (e.g., "v1").
        • Content-Type: Specifies the response content type (e.g., "application/json").

    • uploadData

      @PostMapping("/upload") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ItemPriceResponse> uploadData(@RequestParam("file") org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file) throws IOException, ParseException
      Handles the upload of a CSV file containing item price data. This endpoint accepts a CSV file as a multipart form-data request, processes the file using the IUploadDataService, and returns a response indicating the success of the operation. The response includes metadata, a status code, and custom headers.
      Parameters:
      file - The CSV file to be uploaded. The file must contain the following columns: ITEM_ID, PRICE, and ORD_CLOSED_DT. The file should be provided as a multipart form-data parameter with the key "file".
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing an ItemPriceResponse object. The response includes:
      • Metadata: A CustomResponse object with a success message.
      • Status Code: The HTTP status code (200 for success).
      • Headers: Custom headers including API method, version, and content type.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.
      ParseException - If the file contains invalid data (e.g., incorrect date format).
      See Also:
      • IUploadDataService
      • ItemPriceResponse
      • CustomResponse
      • HttpHeaders
      • Example request: 
         POST /upload
 Content-Type: multipart/form-data

 file: example.csv
        Example response: 
         {
     "metadata": {
         "message": "Data cargada con exito"
     },
     "status_code": "200"
 }
        The CSV file must adhere to the following format: 
         ITEM_ID,PRICE,ORD_CLOSED_DT
 1,10.5,2023-10-01
 2,20.0,2023-10-02
        Custom headers included in the response:
        • API-Method: Indicates the API method used (e.g., "upload").
        • API-Version: Indicates the API version (e.g., "v1").
        • Content-Type: Specifies the response content type (e.g., "application/json").

    • findById

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Product> findById(@PathVariable("id") String id)
